text: Draft @ the brewery. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a roasted malty chocolate caramel and coffee aroma. Roasted malty chocolate and coffee flavor. Has a roasted malty chocolate caramel finish.
In flight at brewery. Roasty creamy aroma. Intense bitter coffee chocolate taste. Black licorice items too. Solid.
[1/25/17] Draught at Cellarmaker in San Francisco. Black with a tan head. Roast, coffee, chocolate. Bittersweet, bitter finish.
On tap at the brewery. Comes black with an average tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, and malt. Taste is coffee, dark chocolate, roasted malt, and some caramel. Mild bitterness. Very good.

From tap at the brewery. Black color with beige brown head. Roasted malty aroma, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, licorice. Light sweet and moderate bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

4 oz pour on draft at Cellarmaker during the RateBeer Best 2017 bus tour. Batch 2. Black with light tan head. Aromas of roasted coffee, dark chocolate. Tastes of roasted coffee, dark chocolate, caramel. Medium body with a dry finish. Really nice porter.

Tap at the brewpub. Pours black with brown dense foam. Aroma is strong coffee and chocolate, some caramel, yet not boozy at all. Body is heavy, laid back bitterness, nicely sweet, soft and round carbonation. Palate turns this into a warming sipper, gracious.

@RBB
Robust nose body and flavor! Chocolate, light coffee and earth. Nice porter!
On tap at Beercraft. Pours black with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is cracker malt, roast, raisin, wood. Medium body, wood, roast, chocolate, nice dry fiish, very good.
On tap at cellarmaker pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is coffee nice roast malts some chocolate. Taste is more of the nice coffee roast some smoke.

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2017  taproom@:  I drunk it several times and Its for sure best porter I ever had. Pours almost black, actually dark brown, opaque, slightly oily, with stable foamy light brown head. Aroma-flavors: intense malt notes, which takes on dark chocolate, coffee, cacao nibs, molasses, hint of dried apricots, tobacco...body is medium but almost thick, texture velvetly, carbonation is moderate.

On draft at Caps & Taps. It pours a dark brown color with a medium brown, creamy head. The aroma has coffee, a little smoke, hints of burnt sugar and fig. The flavor is rich and smoky with some bread, fig, dates and light hints of roasted acidity, although it remains rich and creamy on the palate. The finish is smoky with light hints of ash. A very complex and satisfying Porter. Surprisingly good from the hop masters.
TAP. Black oil pour with thick tanned head.. Heavy burnt malt nose, coffee as well.. Big thick dark body, burnt quality, some light coffee with bitter finish.. Sourced cellarmaker brewing
Draft. Black beer with a dark tan head. Roast and chocolate aroma. Chocolate and roast flavor with light cherry. Medium bodied. Roast and chocolate lingers with light cherry.
Tap at Cellarmaker. Black body with tan foam. nice roasty, dark chocolate, molasses spicy aromas. Smooth mouthfeel. Rich roasty, earthy dirt, Chocolate , spicy flavors---very tasty porter
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: On tap at Cellarmaker. Pours near black with an attractive tan head and a chocolate and treacle aroma. There is a medium-bodied dark molasses flavor with a bit of chocolate and a dry finish.

Draft at the brewpub. Black beer with a solid light brown head. Good amount of lacing. Nice mix of coffee, roast and chocolate. Mild caramel. Rich and nice. Taste is mildly sweet. Big chocolate. Good roast comes through without dominating. No real cola flavor. Mild acidity. Very good. Nice full body with a soft feel. This is an ultra solid straight porter. Not quite Everett but up there. I like it a lot.
(En fût à la source): Très anisé, soda raisin, mélasse et une texture massive et collante.

Tap. Pours inky black, medium creamy tan head, great lacing. Aroma is rich roasty, hints of ashtray, faint rubber, coffee grounds, cocoa. Flavor is light plus sweet,, medium bitter. Full body, creamy.
At the brewery. No BS. Just a baller porter. Chocolatey and delicious. Love that there arent adjuncts in here.

Had this on "Country Sunday" at Cellarmaker. The beertenders there were wearing shirts that read: "I listen to Merle Haggard and drink Cellarmaker beer". How apropos, given the name of this beer, which is a pun on Dolly Partons late music partner. One nit with Cellarmakers commercial description...I actually think the viscosity is probably 0W-20 or 5W-20.
